intro: Palala andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman Islands palala, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
